Question: What does the Big O notation measure in complexity analysis?
Option A: a. Space complexity
Option B: b. Time complexity
Option C: c. Both time and space complexity
Option D: d. None of the above
Correct Option: b. Time complexity

Question: Which of the following statements is true about the time complexity of an algorithm?
Option A: a. O(n^2) is always faster than O(n)
Option B: b. O(n) is always faster than O(n^2)
Option C: c. The time complexity of an algorithm cannot be determined
Option D: d. O(n^2) and O(n) have the same time complexity
Correct Option: b. O(n) is always faster than O(n^2)

Question: What is the time complexity of the following algorithm: for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) { } }?
Option A: a. O(n)
Option D: d. O(log n)

Question: An algorithm has a time complexity of O(2^n). What can be said about the algorithm?
Option A: a. It is very efficient for large inputs
Option B: b. It is suitable for small inputs only
Option C: c. It is independent of the input size
Option D: d. It has a time complexity of O(n)
Correct Option: b. It is suitable for small inputs only

Question: Consider the following recurrence relation: T(n) = 2T(n/2) + n. What is the time complexity of this algorithm using the Master Theorem?
Option A: a. O(n log n)
Option C: c. O(n)
Option D: d. O(log n)
Correct Option: a. O(n log n)
Subtopic Detail: Solving Recurrence Relations using Master Theorem

Question: What is an array in data structures?
Option A: a. A collection of objects of different data types.
Option B: b. A collection of objects of the same data type stored in contiguous memory locations.
Option C: c. A collection of objects with a fixed size.
Option D: d. A collection of objects with a dynamic size.
Correct Option: b. A collection of objects of the same data type stored in contiguous memory locations.

Question: What is the time complexity of accessing an element in an array?
Option A: a. O(n)
Option C: c. O(log n)

Question: What is the purpose of the 'next' pointer in a node of a Linked List?
Option A: a. To point to the previous node.
Option B: b. To point to the current node.
Option C: c. To point to the next node.
Option D: d. To point to the head node.
Correct Option: c. To point to the next node.

Question: What is the time complexity of inserting a new node at the end of a singly Linked List?
Option B: b. O(n)
Option C: c. O(log n)
Correct Option: b. O(n)

Question: Consider a scenario where we need to frequently insert or delete elements at arbitrary positions in a data structure. Which data structure is more suitable for this scenario?
Option A: a. Array
Option B: b. Linked List
Option C: c. Stack
Option D: d. Queue
Correct Option: b. Linked List
Subtopic Detail: Choice of data structure based on operations

Question: What is the primary purpose of a stack data structure?
Option A: a. To store data in a random order.
Option B: b. To store data in a specific order, with the most recent addition being the first to be removed.
Option C: c. To store data in a linked list format.
Option D: d. To store data in a tree-like structure.
Correct Option: b. To store data in a specific order, with the most recent addition being the first to be removed.

Question: What is the process of adding an element to a stack called?
Option A: a. Push
Option B: b. Pop
Option C: c. Enqueue
Option D: d. Dequeue
Correct Option: a. Push

Question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a queue data structure?
Option A: a. Elements are added and removed from the middle.
Option B: b. Elements are added to the end and removed from the front.
Option C: c. Elements are added to the front and removed from the end.
Option D: d. Elements are added and removed randomly.
Correct Option: b. Elements are added to the end and removed from the front.

Question: What is the time complexity of implementing a stack using an array?
Option A: a. O(n)
Option C: c. O(log n)

Question: Given a queue with n elements, what is the minimum number of enqueue and dequeue operations required to reverse the order of the elements?
Option A: a. n
Option B: b. 2n
Option C: c. n/2
Option D: d. n^2
Correct Option: b. 2n

Question: What is the primary purpose of a hash function in a hash table?
Option A: a. To sort the data in a table
Option B: b. To store data in a table
Option C: c. To map a key to an index in a table
Option D: d. To search for data in a table
Correct Option: c. To map a key to an index in a table

Question: What happens when two keys hash to the same index in a hash table?
Option A: a. The data is lost
Option B: b. The data is stored in a linked list
Option C: c. The data is stored in a separate table
Option D: d. An error occurs
Correct Option: b. The data is stored in a linked list

Question: What is the average time complexity of searching for an element in a hash table?
Option A: a. O(n)
Option B: b. O(log n)

Question: What is the purpose of a load factor in a hash table?
Option A: a. To measure the size of the table
Option B: b. To measure the number of collisions
Option C: c. To determine when to resize the table
Option D: d. To determine when to rehash the table
Correct Option: c. To determine when to resize the table

Question: What is the main drawback of using open addressing in a hash table?
Option A: a. It is slower than chaining
Option B: b. It is more difficult to implement
Option C: c. It can lead to clustering
Option D: d. It uses more memory
Correct Option: c. It can lead to clustering

Question: What is the basic principle of recursion?
Option A: a. Breaking down a problem into smaller sub-problems.
Option B: b. Solving a problem iteratively.
Option C: c. Using a loop to repeat a sequence of operations.
Option D: d. Using dynamic programming to memoize results.
Correct Option: a. Breaking down a problem into smaller sub-problems.

Question: Which of the following is an important consideration when writing a recursive function?
Option A: a. Ensuring the function has a high time complexity.
Option B: b. Ensuring the function has a low space complexity.
Option C: c. Ensuring the function has a base case to terminate.
Option D: d. Ensuring the function uses a loop instead of recursion.
Correct Option: c. Ensuring the function has a base case to terminate.

Question: What is backtracking used for in problem-solving?
Option A: a. To find the optimal solution to a problem.
Option B: b. To find a possible solution to a problem by exploring all possibilities.
Option C: c. To reduce the time complexity of a problem.
Option D: d. To increase the space complexity of a problem.
Correct Option: b. To find a possible solution to a problem by exploring all possibilities.

Question: How does recursion help in solving the N-Queens problem?
Option A: a. By reducing the time complexity of the problem.
Option B: b. By using dynamic programming to memoize results.
Option C: c. By exploring all possible configurations of queens on the board.
Option D: d. By using a loop to iterate over the board.
Correct Option: c. By exploring all possible configurations of queens on the board.

Question: What is the role of the recursive call in the recursive function for the Fibonacci sequence?
Option A: a. To calculate the next number in the sequence using the previous two numbers.
Option B: b. To calculate the sum of all numbers in the sequence.
Option C: c. To terminate the recursion when the base case is reached.
Option D: d. To initialize the sequence with the first two numbers.
Correct Option: a. To calculate the next number in the sequence using the previous two numbers.
